intro: Oenanthe biebersteinii f. brevisecta, commonly known as the short-stemmed water dropwort, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
